WHO RECOMMENDATIONS ON POSTNATAL CARE OF THE MOTHER AND NEWBORN
Women should be observed for any risks, signs and symptoms of domestic abuse. Women 
should be told who to contact for advice and management.
All women should be asked about resumption of sexual intercourse and possible 
dyspareunia as part of an assessment of overall well-being two to six weeks after birth.
